repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection contains records of locomotive engines built between 1861 and 1921 and used by the Great Western Railway.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Great Western Railway (GWR), which was founded in 1833, linked London with the southwest and west of England, the West Midlands, and most of Wales. The first train on the railway ran in 1838 and the trains were known to run on broader gauges than other railway services. The GWR updated its lines in the early 20th century and added restaurant cars and steam heaters. In 1914, during the first World War, the government took control of the railroad, but after the war, unlike some railroads, it was allowed to maintain its independence. After the second World War, the GWR became the Western Region of British Railways on January 1, 1948. In 2015, the name of the railroad reverted back to the Great Western Railway in honor of its founders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Owned or compiled in part by William Kenning, Lodge Hill, Sussex, Great Britain, this collection contains registers with records of locomotive engines built between 1861-1921 and used by the railway company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Great Western Railway Records, Undated. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Great Western Railway Records).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from dealer Francis Edwards Ltd. of London in 1969.
